title: How to get a free Freakonomics book in PDF - Quora

response.answer_text: Go to your local library’s website and see if you can get a digital copy and borrow it in your desired format. Otherwise, don’t do further damage to the efforts of authors and publishers to earn a living. Even authors of bestselling books earn only a few dollars per copies, and may have only a single bestseller in their entire life. They probably have devoted two or three years to completing that book. If you can’t be bothered to go to a library to avoid paying a few dollars to read it, or pick up a Kindle version of these bestsellers when they come up on sale (which they do, frequently — I paid $2.99 for mine in just such a sale) — shame on you. It’s unethical. Oh, and it’s illegal. It’s theft of someone’s intellectual property. Go ahead, pat yourself on the back on the assumption that you won’t get caught. And know that there are a substantial number of people who will despise you for your behavior.
